speaker: Teacher
dialogue: Okay, class! For your midterm project, you will be doing a presentation on any era we've learned in class so far. I want you to meet your group members and choose a topic before the bell rings.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: The teacher calls out names and the students push their desks together. There are mostly groups of four, but one group of three is formed as well.

speaker: Narrator
dialogue: Alec could clearly tell that the two girls did not want to be there very much. And so, to cut down on the awkwardness, he decided to take the reigns.

speaker: Alec
dialogue: Does anyone have any ideas about a possible topic?

speaker: Chloe
dialogue: I've got one: today's era! We're living in it, so there's not much to research!

speaker: Alec
dialogue: Yeah, I wish. But, unfortunately, we need to choose something from class.

speaker: Chloe
dialogue: Aww, you're no fun! Do you have anything better?

speaker: Alec
dialogue: I was thinking something like the Industrial Revolution.

speaker: Alec
dialogue: There are so many cool inventions that we could talk about. Like the cotton gin! And the steam engine!

speaker: Chloe
dialogue: Ooh! Steam engine sounds cool. I vote for that idea!

speaker: Chloe
dialogue: It's official. We're doing the inbustrial whatever and talking about steam engines!
